title: High Dependence on Service Exports
description: In 2023, communications, computer, and other services accounted for 95.93% of Papua New Guinea's service exports, indicating a strong reliance on this sector.

title: Significant Rural Population
description: As of 2023, 86.28% of Papua New Guinea's population resides in rural areas, highlighting a predominantly rural demographic.

title: Low Urbanization Rate
description: Only 13.72% of the population lived in urban areas in 2023, reflecting limited urban development.

title: Frequent Power Outages
description: In 2015, firms in Papua New Guinea experienced an average of 41.9 power outages per month, impacting business operations.

title: High Rate of Electrical Outages in Firms
description: A staggering 97.7% of firms reported experiencing electrical outages in 2015, indicating significant infrastructure challenges.

title: Prevalence of Informal Payments
description: In 2015, 89.3% of firms reported making informal payments to public officials, suggesting widespread corruption.

title: High Incidence of Theft and Vandalism
description: 61.5% of firms experienced losses due to theft and vandalism in 2015, highlighting security concerns.

title: Strong Focus on Employee Training
description: In 2015, 73.7% of firms offered formal training, indicating a commitment to workforce development.

title: Low Hospital Bed Availability
description: With only 0.17 hospital beds per 1,000 people in 2019, Papua New Guinea faces significant healthcare infrastructure challenges.

title: High Pupil-Teacher Ratio in Secondary Education
description: In 2016, the pupil-teacher ratio in upper secondary education was 83.26, indicating potential challenges in educational quality.

title: Minimal Stock Market Activity
description: The turnover ratio of domestic shares was only 0.0535% in 2017, reflecting limited stock market activity.

title: Low Personal Transfer Receipts
description: In 2023, personal transfers to Papua New Guinea amounted to $143,486, indicating low remittance inflows.

title: Limited Aid from Sweden
description: In 2022, net bilateral aid flows from Sweden were $9,999, suggesting limited financial support from this donor.
